description: Unique identifier of the inventory movement this line belongs to; ties detail lines to a single posting.
Sequential line number within the same transaction header; used to order and uniquely identify the line.
Item or part identifier (SKU/part number) moved.
Code for the facility or store where the item was stored or moved.
Storage location within the facility (aisle/bin/shelf) for the item.
Human-readable item description at the time of movement.
Number of units moved on this line; sign may indicate issue versus receipt.
Unit of measure used for the quantity on this line.
Conversion factor between the transaction unit and the stocking unit (units per transaction unit).
Cost per transaction unit applied at posting time.
Extended amount for the line (quantity Ã— unit cost), typically excluding tax.
Work order associated with the part issue or return, if applicable.
Reference to the specific parts line on the related work order.
Code for the vehicle/equipment system or category related to the usage; confirm with SME.
Pick/issue slip or material ticket reference for this movement.
Purchasing document reference tied to the movement (e.g., purchase order).
General ledger account to charge or credit for this line.
Supplier identifier associated with the item or transaction.
Shipment or receiving document identifier linked to this movement; confirm with SME.
Code indicating movement type (e.g., issue, receipt, adjustment). "I" likely indicates an issue; confirm with SME.
Most recent activity or update date for this line; confirm with SME.
Internal item master identifier for the part.
Release number for a blanket order or shipment schedule; confirm with SME.
Date for the referenced release.
Manufacturer or equipment model reference related to the item; confirm with SME.
Commodity or classification code for reporting and controls.
Indicator for special handling or status (e.g., serialized, repairable); confirm with SME.
Original or list price used prior to discounts or adjustments.
Actual transaction price after discounts or overrides.
Identifier of the picking process or reservation transaction that generated this movement; confirm with SME.
Indicator that the line represents a return or reversal to stock.
Reference to the receiving transaction tied to this item.
Actual date the item was returned to inventory.
Expected date for a planned return to stock; useful for temporary issues.
Location on the asset where the part was installed, or storage location text; confirm with SME.
Work order line updated by this movement, or flag to trigger update; confirm with SME.
User who created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User who last modified the record.
Timestamp of the most recent modification.
Inventory control method or status code (e.g., cycle count, FIFO); confirm with SME.
Identifier of the vehicle or equipment consuming the part.
Flag indicating whether tax applies to this line.
Tax percentage applied to the taxable amount.
Tax amount calculated for this line.
Counted quantity used for physical inventory reconciliation or adjustments.
